en: For everything there is a season, and a time for every purpose under heaven:
hmr: Vân hnuoia hin thiltum tinrêng ta dingin hun a um a, thil tinrêng ta dingin hunbi a um:

en: a time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;
hmr: Pieng hun a um a, thi hun a um a; Phun hun a um a, phunsahai phâwi hun a um bawk a;

en: a time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;
hmr: Sukhlum hun le sukdam hun a um a, Ṭhiek hun le bâwl hun a um a;

en: a time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;
hmr: Ṭap hun le innui hun a um a, Sûnna hun le lâm hun a um a;

en: a time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
hmr: Lung peihâwn hun le lung lâk khâwm hun a um a, Pawm hun le pawmnaa inthawk insûm hun a um a;

en: a time to seek, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
hmr: Zawng hun le inhmang hun a um a, Vawng hun le peihâwn hun a um a;

en: a time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
hmr: Keithlêr hun le ṭhui hun a um a, To ṭawk ṭawk hun le thu hril hun a um a;

en: a time to love, and a time to hate; a time for war, and a time for peace.
hmr: Hmangai hun le theida hun a um a, Indo hun le inrem hun a um a;

en: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboreth?
hmr: Sinthawtu chun a sininrimnaah ieng hlâwkna am a hmu a?

en: I have seen the travail which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised therewith.
hmr: Chutaka an buoipui ngei ding mihriem nauhai kuoma chun Pathien chun sin dinga a pêk chu ka hmuh a.

en: He hath made everything beautiful in its time: also he hath set eternity in their heart, yet so that man cannot find out the work that God hath done from the beginning even to the end.
hmr: Thil tinrêng chu mâni hun senga mawi dingin a siem a; a bula inthawka a tâwp chena Pathienin sin a thaw chu mihriemin a hriet suok thei nawna dingin, an lungrilah khawvêl chu a ruotdet bawk a.

en: I know that there is nothing better for them, than to rejoice, and to do good so long as they live.
hmr: An dam sûng poa thil ṭha thawa hlima um nêka an ta dinga ṭha lem iengkhawm a um nawh ti ka hriet a.

en: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy good in all his labor, is the gift of God.
hmr: Chun, mi tinin a sinthaw inrim- na po poa thil ṭha a chêna, a dâwna a fâk chu Pathien thilthlâwnpêk a nih.

en: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor anything taken from it; and God hath done it, that men should fear before him.
hmr: Pathienin a thaw taphawt kum- khuoa ding a nih ti ka hriet a; chu- taka chun iengkhawm belsa thei ni naw ni a, iengkhawm lâkṭhe thei ni naw nih; Ama hmaa mihriemhai chu an ṭit theina dingin Pathien chun a thaw tah a nih.

en: That which is hath been long ago; and that which is to be hath long ago been: and God seeketh again that which is passed away.
hmr: Thil hung umhai chu um ta hnung dai kha a na, la hung ding khawm chu ni ta hnung dai kha a nih: thil fe liem ta hnung kha Pathien chun a hung lâk kîr nâwk pei a nih.

en: And moreover I saw under the sun, in the place of justice, that wickedness was there; and in the place of righteousness, that wickedness was there.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun nisa hnuoia hin, rorêlna umnaa chun, rîtlona khawm a um a; felna umna hmuna chun rîtlona khawm a um ka hmuh a.

en: I said in my heart, God will judge the righteous and the wicked; for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.
hmr: Ka lungril chun, “Pathien chun mi fel le rilo chunga chun ro rêl a tih; sin tinrêng le thiltum tinrênga dingin hun a um sih a,” ka tih a.

en: I said in my heart, It is because of the sons of men, that God may prove them, and that they may see that they themselves are but as beasts.
hmr: Ka lungril ma chun, “Mihriem nauhai lei a ni hi; Pathien chun anni chu a fie theina ding le, anni khawma ramsahai ang chau an nih ti an hrietsuok theina dingin,” ka tih a.

en: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; and man hath no preeminence above the beasts: for all is vanity.
hmr: Chu thil mihriem nauhai chunga tlung chu ramsahai chunga khawm a tlung sih a; pakhat a thi angin a dang khawm chu an thih a. Thuok angkhat nei seng an nih a, mihriem chun ramsahai nêka chung- hnungbîkna a nei nawh; thil po po chu teplo el a ni sih a.

en: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.
hmr: An rêngin hmun pakhatah an feh a; an rêngin pilvuta inthawk an na, an rêngin pilvut an inchang nâwk a.

en: Who knoweth the spirit of man, whether it goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast, whether it goeth downward to the earth?
hmr: Mihriem thlarau chu chung- tieng a feh a; ramsa thlarau chu hnuoitieng hnuoiah a fe ti tuin am a hriet a?

en: Wherefore I saw that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him back to see what shall be after him?
hmr: Chuleiin, miin a sinthawhaia a hlim nêka ṭha lem iengkhawm ka hmu nawh; chu chu ama chanpuol a na, ama hnunga thil hung um dinghai chu hmu dingin tuin am ama chu hung ṭhuoi kîr tâng a ti leh?
